Bash(git commit -m "Add complete OpenDirectory enterprise UEM platform

- Enterprise services with Active Directory replacement
- Universal MDM for all platforms
- Group Policy management
- Bulk operations and import tools
- Complete web interfaces
- Docker and Kubernetes deployment configurations
- Multi-platform deployment agents
- Comprehensive documentation")

Bash(git commit -m "Add .gitignore for sensitive data protection and update Claude settings

- Comprehensive .gitignore to exclude sensitive files, credentials, and build artifacts
- Updated Claude local settings
- Ensures no private data is accidentally committed to repository")

Bash(git commit -m "üèóÔ∏è Reorganize service architecture - Consolidated structure

- Moved all services to unified /services directory
- Created organized structure:
  - /services/core - Essential platform services (7 services)
  - /services/enterprise - Advanced enterprise features (50+ services)
  - /services/domains - DDD bounded contexts (7 domains)
  - /services/api-backend - Main REST API
  - /services/integration-service - External integrations
- Added service-manager.sh for unified service management
- Updated documentation to reflect new structure
- Total: 66 services organized in clear hierarchy

Benefits:
- Better organization and maintainability
- Clear separation of concerns
- Easier service discovery
- Simplified dependency management
- Consistent structure across all services")

Bash(git commit -m "üßπ Repository Cleanup - Keep Only Essential Files

- Moved test-integration.sh to services/tests/ for better organization
- Updated Makefile for new service structure
- Added service management commands to Makefile
- Kept windows-deployment-agent.ps1 (essential for Windows MDM)

Makefile now supports:
- make services-list (list all services)
- make services-count (show statistics)  
- make services-start (start services)
- make services-health (health check)")

Bash(git commit -m "üñ®Ô∏è Add comprehensive printer and scanner management system

Features:
- Complete CUPS integration for universal printer support
- Automatic printer discovery (mDNS, SSDP, SNMP, IPP, WSD)
- Cross-platform deployment (Windows, macOS, Linux, iOS, Android)
- Advanced permissions and quota management
- Print job queue with real-time monitoring
- Scanner integration with SANE backend
- OCR capabilities for scanned documents
- Environmental impact tracking
- Cost analytics and departmental billing
- Modern web UI for printer management

Technical Implementation:
- Node.js microservice with CUPS backend
- WebSocket for real-time updates
- PostgreSQL for persistence
- Redis for caching and job queue
- Bull for async job processing
- Support for IPP, RAW, LPD, and SMB protocols
- Docker containerization with privileged mode for device access

ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>")
